intro: Thalictrum lecoyeri var. debilistylum, commonly known as the slender meadow rue, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It has a low-growing habit with a branching stem and is often found in association with other herbaceous plants. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
